meanings.definition: The act of syndicating or the state of being syndicated.
meanings.sent1: The syndications of news articles help reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent2: Many TV shows rely on syndications to air in different regions.
meanings.sent3: The syndications of jokes among friends always bring laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her syndications of kindness spread like wildfire in the community.
meanings.sent5: The syndications of gossip in the office are hard to control.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals or organizations combined to promote some common interest.
meanings.sent1: The syndications of businesses worked together to improve the local economy.
meanings.sent2: The syndications of charities raised funds for a good cause.
meanings.sent3: The syndications of book clubs met regularly to discuss their favorite reads.
meanings.sent4: Their syndications of talents created a powerful team.
meanings.sent5: The syndications of students organized a successful event.
